result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony E Geiger

defendant.name: Geiger, Anthony E
defendant.address: N4806 Knight Lake Rd, Merrill, WI 54452

records.addlTxt: Body or $250.00

10:00 AM Defendant Anthony E Geiger not in court.  Attorney James Charles Koppelman Mr. in court for Anthony E Geiger.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case called appearances given.  Deft does not appear  Attorney Koppelman has tried to call the deft.  State is requesting a bench warrant w/$250.  Defense attorney responds.  Court addresses the parties.  Court orders the bench warrant w/$250   Parties to take care of some of the matters w/o the deft.  Court to address the records of the victim.   Defense does not have the records of the victim.  State addresses the court as to the records of the victim.  Arguments heard. from the parties. Defense wondering if there is a video of them going to the house. State informs the court that there is not body cams. Court directs the State to check on any recordings in regards to the entry to the home.  Defense states that there is like 5 statements according to the report.  No other matters to be take up without the deft.
for modification of bond

Statement by Atty Polzin - victim rights scheduling conference; no victim wishes to be heard.  Statement by the Court - off the record scheduling with Judicial Assistant.
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Statement by Atty Polzin - victim rights scheduling conference; no victim wishes to be heard.  Statement by the Court - off the record scheduling with Judicial Assistant.

No contact with the victim.  Submit to Lincoln County Sheriff's Department for booking if not already completed.

No contact with the victim.  Submit to Lincoln County Sheriff's Department for booking if not already completed.

10:04 AM - case called.  Defendant Anthony E Geiger in court.  Attorney James Charles Koppelman Mr. in court for Anthony E Geiger.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Statement by Atty Koppelman - in receipt of complaint - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Argument by State as to bond.  Response by Atty Koppelman.  Court sets bond.  Court directs the cash bond be returned to the poster.
Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
